column7: カップが欠けてしまった。
column8: The cup is chipped.
column9: Kappu ga kakete shimatta.
column10: Refers to something missing a part or being damaged.

column7: 毎日運動を欠かさずに続けている。
column8: I continue exercising every day without missing.
column9: Mainichi undō o kakasazu ni tsuzukete iru.
column10: Refers to neglecting or missing an action or task.

column7: 旅行には必需品を忘れずに持っていくことが大切だ。
column8: It’s important to bring necessities when traveling.
column9: Ryokō ni wa hitsujuhin o wasurezu ni motte iku koto ga taisetsu da.
column10: Refers to essential or necessary items.

column7: みんなで彼を囲んで祝った。
column8: Everyone surrounded him and celebrated.
column9: Minna de kare o kakonde iwatta.
column10: Refers to surrounding someone or something physically.

column7: 彼の浅ましい行動は許せない。
column8: His despicable behavior is unforgivable.
column9: Kare no asamashii kōdō wa yurusenai.
column10: Describes something morally reprehensible.

column7: 悪どい商売をしていると噂されている。
column8: He is rumored to be involved in vicious business.
column9: Akudoi shōbai o shiteiru to uwasa sarete iru.
column10: Describes something immoral, excessive, or flashy.

column7: パソコンを充電するためにコンセントに差し込んだ。
column8: I plugged it into the socket to charge my computer.
column9: Pasokon o jūden suru tame ni konsento ni sashikonda.
column10: Refers to an electrical outlet or socket.

column7: 夏にはグリーンカーテンで涼しくなる。
column8: In summer, the green wall keeps the room cool.
column9: Natsu ni wa gurīn kāten de suzushiku naru.
column10: Refers to plants grown to block sunlight and cool down areas.

column7: 感情を抑制することは大切だ。
column8: It is important to restrain one’s emotions.
column9: Kanjo o yokusei suru koto wa taisetsu da.
column10: Refers to self-control or restraining something.

column7: 今年の収穫は豊作だ。
column8: This year’s harvest is abundant.
column9: Kotoshi no shuukaku wa hōsaku da.
column10: Refers to the act of gathering crops or harvest.

column7: この方法が最適だと思います。
column8: I think this method is the most optimal.
column9: Kono hōhō ga saiteki da to omoimasu.
column10: Describes something most suitable or best in a given context.

column7: 彼女の微笑みは素敵だ。
column8: Her smile is lovely.
column9: Kanojo no hohoemi wa suteki da.
column10: Refers to a gentle or warm smile.

column7: 彼は毎日犬を訓練している。
column8: He trains his dog every day.
column9: Kare wa mainichi inu o kunren shiteiru.
column10: Refers to the process of training or practice.

column7: 怪我が治癒するまでに時間がかかる。
column8: It will take time for the injury to heal.
column9: Kega ga chiyu suru made ni jikan ga kakaru.
column10: Refers to physical or emotional healing.

column7: 彼女の心遣いに感謝している。
column8: I am grateful for her thoughtfulness.
column9: Kanojo no kokorozukai ni kansha shite iru.
column10: Refers to being considerate or thoughtful toward others.

column7: 暴風雨の中で外出するのは危険だ。
column8: It’s dangerous to go out during a rainstorm.
column9: Bōfūu no naka de gaishutsu suru no wa kiken da.
column10: Refers to a heavy rainstorm with strong winds.

column7: 彼は音楽の愛好家だ。
column8: He is a music enthusiast.
column9: Kare wa ongaku no aikōka da.
column10: Refers to someone who has a strong interest or hobby in something.

column7: 彼は大きな困難を克服した。
column8: He overcame a great difficulty.
column9: Kare wa ōkina konnan o kokufuku shita.
column10: Refers to overcoming obstacles or difficulties.

column5: to open out/to become civilized/to develop
column7: この街は急速に開けている。
column8: This town is rapidly developing.
column9: Kono machi wa kyūsoku ni hirakete iru.
column10: Refers to opening up, developing, or becoming more civilized.

column7: 先生は私に怒鳴った。
column8: The teacher yelled at me.
column9: Sensei wa watashi ni donatta.
column10: Refers to shouting or scolding loudly.

column5: disposal/to dispose of/to throw away/to punish
column7: 不要な物を処分する必要がある。
column8: I need to dispose of unnecessary things.
column9: Fuyō na mono o shobun suru hitsuyō ga aru.
column10: Refers to getting rid of or punishing something.

column7: ざわざわとした声が聞こえる。
column8: I hear a noisy rustling sound.
column9: Zawazawa to shita koe ga kikoeru.
column10: Describes noise or rustling sounds, especially in a crowd.

column7: お金を札で支払った。
column8: I paid with paper money.
column9: Okane o satsu de shiharatta.
column10: Refers to bills or banknotes.

column7: 店の看板が新しくなった。
column8: The store's signboard has been renewed.
column9: Mise no kanban ga atarashiku natta.
column10: Refers to a signboard or notice board.

column7: 瀬戸内海には美しい瀬戸がたくさんある。
column8: There are many beautiful straits in the Seto Inland Sea.
column9: Seto Naikai ni wa utsukushī seto ga takusan aru.
column10: Refers to a narrow body of water between two landmasses or a region famous for pottery.

column7: 煉瓦で作られた家が美しい。
column8: The house made of bricks is beautiful.
column9: Renga de tsukurareta ie ga utsukushii.
column10: Refers to a brick, used in construction.

column7: 硝子のコップを割ってしまった。
column8: I broke the glass cup.
column9: Garasu no koppu o watte shimatta.
column10: Refers to glass, such as windows or cups.

column7: このビルの裏側には駐車場がある。
column8: There is a parking lot on the backside of this building.
column9: Kono biru no uragawa ni wa chūshajō ga aru.
column10: Refers to the back side or reverse side of something.

column7: 部屋をペンキで塗り替えた。
column8: I repainted the room with paint.
column9: Heya o penki de nurikaita.
column10: Refers to paint, typically used for walls or surfaces.

column7: 当軒の製品は全て手作りです。
column8: All of the products in this store are handmade.
column9: Tōken no seihin wa subete tezukuri desu.
column10: Used to refer to the shop or place you're talking about.

column7: 大通りに面した場所は人気があります。
column8: Places facing the main street are popular.
column9: Ōdōri ni meshi-ta basho wa ninki ga arimasu.
column10: Refers to a major street or avenue in a city.

column7: 予め準備をしておいた方がいい。
column8: It’s better to prepare in advance.
column9: Arakajime junbi o shite oita hō ga ii.
column10: Used to describe something done in advance.

column7: 前もって知らせてください。
column8: Please inform me in advance.
column9: Maemotte shirasete kudasai.
column10: Similar to 予め, used for advance actions.

column7: その話はありふれているので、誰も信じない。
column8: That story is so common that no one believes it.
column9: Sono hanashi wa arifurete iru node, dare mo shinjinai.
column10: Describes something that is common or ordinary.

column7: 依然として問題は解決されていない。
column8: The problem remains unsolved as before.
column9: Izen to shite mondai wa kaiketsu sarete inai.
column10: Refers to something that remains the same over time.

column7: 彼は一心に仕事に取り組んでいる。
column8: He is working with his whole heart.
column9: Kare wa isshin ni shigoto ni torikunde iru.
column10: Describes someone focused or devoted to a task.

column7: 彼の自惚れがひどくて、誰も近づきたがらない。
column8: His ego is so bad that no one wants to get close to him.
column9: Kare no unnbore ga hidokute, dare mo chikadukitagaranai.
column10: Refers to arrogance or excessive pride in oneself.

column7: 身近な人々と一緒に過ごす時間が一番大切だ。
column8: The time spent with close people is the most important.
column9: Mijika na hitobito to issho ni sugosu jikan ga ichiban taisetsu da.
column10: Refers to something close or familiar, such as people or places.

column7: 彼の身なりはいつも整っている。
column8: His appearance is always neat.
column9: Kare no minari wa itsumo totono tte iru.
column10: Refers to one's dress or overall appearance.

column7: 無駄遣いをしないように気をつけている。
column8: I’m careful not to waste money.
column9: Mudazukai o shinai yō ni ki o tsukete iru.
column10: Refers to unnecessary waste or extravagance.

column7: その証拠は明白だ。
column8: The evidence is clear.
column9: Sono shōko wa meihaku da.
column10: Describes something that is clear or easily understood.

column7: 時計の目盛りが細かくて見やすい。
column8: The tick marks on the clock are fine and easy to read.
column9: Tokei no memori ga komakakute miyasu i.
column10: Refers to divisions on a scale, like a ruler or clock.

column7: 彼は手伝いを申し出た。
column8: He offered to help.
column9: Kare wa tetsudai o mōshideta.
column10: Refers to offering something or making a suggestion.

column7: ベルトが緩んでいる。
column8: The belt is loose.
column9: Beruto ga yurunde iru.
column10: Refers to something loosening or relaxing.

column7: 今日、やけに暑いですね。
column8: It’s terribly hot today, isn’t it?
column9: Kyō, yakenii atsui desu ne.
column10: Describes something unusually or excessively.

column7: 親は子供を養う責任がある。
column8: Parents have the responsibility to raise their children.
column9: Oya wa kodomo o yashinau sekinin ga aru.
column10: Refers to nurturing, raising, or supporting someone.

column7: コーヒーもしくは紅茶を選んでください。
column8: Please choose coffee or tea.
column9: Kōhī moshikuwa kōcha o erande kudasai.
column10: A formal way of saying "or" in a sentence.

column7: 山の頂上から見渡すと、素晴らしい景色が広がっていた。
column8: From the top of the mountain, a wonderful view spread out.
column9: Yama no chōjō kara miwatasu to, subarashī keshiki ga hirogatte ita.
column10: Refers to surveying or looking out over a wide area.

column7: 無言のまま立ち去った。
column8: He left without saying a word.
column9: Mugon no mama tachisatta.
column10: Describes a state of silence or being wordless.

column7: 見苦しい姿勢をしている。
column8: He has an ugly posture.
column9: Migurushī shisei o shite iru.
column10: Describes something unpleasant to look at or disgraceful.

column7: それができないなら、ましてあなたには無理だろう。
column8: If you can't do that, then it will be impossible for you.
column9: Sore ga dekinai nara, mashite anata ni wa muri darou.
column10: Used to emphasize something even more than what was mentioned before.

column5: to do/to perform/to give something as charity
column7: 彼は貧しい人々に援助を施した。
column8: He gave assistance to the poor.
column9: Kare wa mazushī hitobito ni enjo o hodokoshita.
column10: Refers to doing something for others, often with a charitable purpose.

column5: to throw out/to give up/to abandon
column7: 彼は問題に直面して、すぐに放り出した。
column8: He faced the problem and immediately gave up.
column9: Kare wa mondai ni chokumen shite, sugu ni hōridashta.
column10: Used when someone abandons something or someone.

column7: 彼はゴミを箱に放り込んだ。
column8: He threw the trash into the box.
column9: Kare wa gomi o hako ni hōrikonda.
column10: Refers to throwing something into a container or place.

column7: 彼はいつものんきに過ごしている。
column8: He always lives in an easy-going way.
column9: Kare wa itsumo nonki ni sugoshite iru.
column10: Refers to being carefree or not thinking things through.

column7: 彼女は朗らかな性格でみんなに好かれている。
column8: She has a cheerful personality and is liked by everyone.
column9: Kanojo wa hogaraka na seikaku de minna ni sukarete iru.
column10: Refers to being bright and cheerful in mood or disposition.

column7: 彼の成績は目覚ましいものだった。
column8: His results were remarkable.
column9: Kare no seiseki wa mezamashī mono datta.
column10: Describes something outstanding or surprising.

column7: この料理は本場で食べると一層美味しい。
column8: This dish tastes even better when eaten at its birthplace.
column9: Kono ryōri wa honba de taberu to issō oishī.
column10: Refers to the original or authentic place where something is made or from.

column7: 彼はいつも言い訳ばかりしている。
column8: He is always making excuses.
column9: Kare wa itsumo iiwake bakari shite iru.
column10: Refers to giving reasons or excuses to justify something.

column7: マスコミはそのニュースを大きく取り上げた。
column8: The media covered that news extensively.
column9: Masukomi wa sono nyūsu o ōkiku toriageta.
column10: Refers to the mass media, including TV, radio, and newspapers.

column5: to judge the right timing or thing
column7: 彼はタイミングを見計らって発表をした。
column8: He judged the right timing and made the announcement.
column9: Kare wa taiming o miharakatte happyō o shita.
column10: Refers to timing something carefully or judging a situation.

column7: 勇ましい行動を見せた彼に感動した。
column8: I was moved by his brave actions.
column9: Isamashī kōdō o miseta kare ni kandō shita.
column10: Describes someone or something that is brave or courageous.

column7: 彼の努力は絶え間ないもので、尊敬に値する。
column8: His effort is constant, and deserves respect.
column9: Kare no doryoku wa taemanai mono de, sonkei ni ataisuru.
column10: Refers to something that is unceasing or continuous.

column7: いわゆる「無駄な努力」をしていた。
column8: I was doing what is called "a futile effort."
column9: Iwayuru "mudana doryoku" o shite ita.
column10: Used to refer to something commonly known or described.

column5: to turn up/to turn over/to flip
column7: 本をめくると、面白い話が出てきた。
column8: When I flipped through the book, an interesting story appeared.
column9: Hon o mekuru to, omoshiroi hanashi ga detekita.
column10: Refers to flipping or turning over something, like pages.

column7: 今日、野外でバーベキューをする予定だ。
column8: We are planning to have a barbecue outdoors today.
column9: Kyō, yagai de bābekyū o suru yotei da.
column10: Refers to activities or events held outdoors.

column5: flexibility/elastic/to accommodate someone with something/to lend
column7: 彼は融通が利く人だ。
column8: He is a flexible person.
column9: Kare wa yūzū ga kiku hito da.
column10: Refers to the ability to be flexible or accommodating.

column7: 私にとって、家族が第一だ。
column8: Family comes first to me.
column9: Watashi ni totte, kazoku ga daiichi da.
column10: Refers to something being the most important or priority.

column7: その努力は空しい結果に終わった。
column8: That effort ended in vain.
column9: Sono doryoku wa munashī kekka ni owatta.
column10: Describes something that is pointless, empty, or futile.

column7: この問題はややこしくて解決するのが難しい。
column8: This problem is complicated and hard to solve.
column9: Kono mondai wa yayakoshikute kaiketsu suru no ga muzukashī.
column10: Refers to something that is difficult to understand or resolve.

column7: パスポートを紛失してしまった。
column8: I lost my passport.
column9: Pasupōto o funshitsu shite shimatta.
column10: Refers to losing something, often something important.

column7: 彼の手腕に感銘を受けた。
column8: I was impressed by his skill.
column9: Kare no shuwan ni kanmei o uketa.
column10: Refers to one's skill or ability in doing something well.

column7: 彼は難儀しているようだ。
column8: He seems to be in trouble.
column9: Kare wa nangi shite iru yō da.
column10: Refers to experiencing difficulty or hardship.
